front.title: TTL Procedures for SR-TE Paths in Label Switched Path Traceroute Mechanisms

abstract.t: Segment routing supports the creation of explicit paths using adjacency-sids, node-sids, and anycast-sids. The SR-TE paths are built by stacking the labels that represent the nodes and links in the explicit path. A very useful Operations And Maintenance requirement is to be able to trace these paths as defined in [RFC8029]. This document specifies a uniform mechanism to support MPLS traceroute for the SR-TE paths when the nodes in the network are following uniform mode or short-pipe mode [RFC3443].
